connect.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to join two or more things together
connect.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors  (=doors that join the rooms).
The railway link would connect Felixstowe with Fishguard.
Connect the speakers to the CD player.
connect.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to realize or show that a fact, event, or person is related to something
connect.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
There is no evidence to connect them with the attack.
connect.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to join something to the main supply of electricity, gas, or water, or to a telephone or computer network
connect.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Has the phone been connected yet?
The power supply should be connected by a qualified electrician.
Click here to connect to the Internet.
connect.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if one train, flight etc connects with another, it arrives just before the other one leaves so that you can continue your journey
connect.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: This train connects with the one to Glasgow.
From Toronto you can connect to all other Air Canada destinations.
connect.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to join two telephone lines so that two people can speak
connect.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Please hold the line. I’m trying to connect you.
connect.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to succeed in hitting someone or something
connect.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: He swung at the ball, but didn’t connect.
connect.translation[0].definitions[6].de: if people connect, they feel that they like each other and understand each other
connect.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: They valued her ability to empathize and connect with others.
